candidates.title: Is This Air Force One During Trump's Visit to Daytona 500?
candidates.content:
Claim:
A photograph shows Air Force One during U.S. President Donald Trump's visit to the Daytona 500 in February 2020.
Rating:
Miscaptioned
About this rating
A photograph supposedly showing Air Force One behind the stands of the Daytona 500 was widely shared on social media on Feb. 16, 2020 as U.S. President Donald Trump was visiting the historic NASCAR racetrack. Trump's campaign manager Brad Parscale, for instance, shared the image with the caption: "@realDonaldTrump won the #Daytona500 before the race even started."
Trump was truly at the Daytona 500 in February 2020. This photograph is also genuine. However, it was taken in 2004 during President George W. Bush's trip to the annual NASCAR race.
The photograph was taken by Jonathan Ferrey and is available via Getty Images.
Parscale deleted his photograph and replaced it with a real image from Trump's visit.
candidates.description: A photograph of Air Force One at the Daytona 500 is real, but it wasn't taken in 2020.

result.explanation: This assessment is evidence-based. The news caption accurately reflects that a photograph of Air Force One at the Daytona 500 was widely shared on social media on February 16, 2020.  However, Snopes reveals that while the photo is genuine and Trump did attend the event in 2020, the specific photo was actually from 2004 during President Bush's visit. The caption is therefore technically accurate in its description of the event, but inaccurate regarding the specific year the photo was taken.  Therefore it is being used out of context, as it implies the photo depicts Trump's 2020 visit, when it actually depicts an earlier event.
supporting_evidence: Source 2:  A photograph supposedly showing Air Force One behind the stands of the Daytona 500 was widely shared on social media on Feb. 16, 2020 as U.S. President Donald Trump was visiting the historic NASCAR racetrack.  However, it was taken in 2004 during President George W. Bush's trip to the annual NASCAR race.
Source 2: Parscale deleted his photograph and replaced it with a real image from Trump's visit.

The caption is thus out of context. Both internal and external checks point to a miscaptioned image. The external check provides strong evidence (including source links) supporting the 2004 date for the picture, which contradicts the 2020 claim in the original caption. Therefore, the caption is out of context.  External confidence score is high (10).  Internal check is low (false). There is no disagreement between the checks: they both agree the caption is inaccurate as to the date of the image and therefore out of context. Overall there is very high confidence in this assessment.  Specific details about the miscaption are provided below for reference purposes.  External validation shows that while the photo is real and depicts Air Force One at the Daytona 500, the photo is from 2004, during President George W. Bush's visit. The caption falsely implies it is from Donald Trump's 2020 visit. The caption uses the correct photo but links it to an incorrect year.  In addition, the specific claim about the photo's origin (February 16, 2020, during Trump's visit) is refuted by the strong external evidence provided in the Snopes article.  Both checks support the final verdict that the caption is out of context.
